It's a thrilling tale of a small-town lawyer who gets an opportunity at a high-end New York City law firm, but soon realizes the firm has sinister secrets. Alternatively, if you're in the mood for something a bit different, "Mama" is a chilling horror film about two sisters raised in isolation, and their new caregiver who must protect them from an otherworldly presence. Enjoy!

Starring Ben Affleck and Jon Hamm, it's about a group of thieves who rob a bank and hold an assistant manager hostage. Things get complicated when one of the crew members falls in love with her.

Alternatively, "The Score" (2016) is another great choice with an all-star cast including Edward Norton, Robert De Niro, and Marlon Brando. The plot revolves around an aging thief hoping to retire but being convinced into doing one last heist with a large payout. Both movies should fit your preferences nicely!

I highly recommend watching "Training Day"! This gripping crime drama stars Denzel Washington as a rogue detective and Ethan Hawke as a rookie cop, exploring their fateful day in Los Angeles' narcotics division. It's a thrilling ride with intense performances that will keep you on the edge of your seat.

If you're interested in a comedy take on the rock 'n' roll lifestyle, "This Is Spinal Tap" is definitely worth checking out! Featuring an ensemble cast including Christopher Guest, Michael McKean, and Harry Shearer, this mockumentary offers a hilarious look at one of England's loudest bands. It's a classic must-watch for fans of music and humor alike.

conversation.text: Based on your interest in war films and a previous heist movie, I'd recommend both "Snitch" and "We Were Soldiers". Both movies offer intense and thought-provoking experiences!
